item.title: HelpaNoob
item.dc:creator: @Truth Truth
item.description:
@Truth wrote:

This script will never work, its Fucked up bad, you have two procedures that need eachother, but it can reconize the procedure unless its above it, please go rewrite your script and then come back.

Read full topic

item.title: HelpaNoob
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[code]program New;
{.include SSI2.txt}
{.include boxbreaker.txt}
{.include RedXIIsFordCracker.txt}

var
enterbutton, playnow : Integer;

procedure Bitmaps;
begin
enterbutton := BitmapFromString(48, 23, ‘z78DAAD98C18EC2300’ +
‘C447F0991B0628FA085FFFFA495680F46D33799A6EDC142C64DE3’ +

‘FD5FC840BD6BB5E6BD0DEA4F1CB9C36F311F700338E9BB05EC28C’ +
‘EC5C72AF95E7CF21AAC9548F5E83BE1415FEA5528EE0FA9160608’ +
‘03437C27E0E313CC77748FC428F15C824B232BDAE4D77F37BEF59’ +
‘F3D27DDA94646930DEA0FFDB447FD1439753ADB7176A8BD374D78’ +
‘6A37481E3A8549E446BE674D149313AB3F77D3F737EF06B57FF65’ +

‘2034777F9189DAFE69A6CA7D087E6AB3B79386048724E8FE7D5FF’ +
‘60FBBE0B’);

playnow := BitmapFromString(65, 14, ‘z78DAAD98CD8EC2300C845’ +
‘FA922610547D0D2F77FA4951A0E8E26DFD486EDC142A9E33833FE’ +
‘2BFDD61FD7DE87BCF4DE5FD36F2BDBABEDFD3EE4422763279EAEF’ +
‘2B7EFD7C7894EF4E4D19EBD4F3278A8526F31C961E1A7DDFAD62E’ +
‘ADB5E75B8E153D2B2F8785683962A88CE451A5BD1E437F22212CB’ +
‘C930E6952142DEC44FC332C503C58A9BE45B9C3439116750AF80B’ +
‘0B882A4554C61F7BBBCFD09B76790BF6ED14B1B102889FDBF1A8E’ +
‘774AFA15FA848361E267622FE565FE327DA516F176C7E53798AB9’ +
‘409810AA14630B7D8873AD725FDD1DEA0FE532795BC8B5CF7A015’ +
‘4B6455F1E1971C805AAB47EECC55CA8F602AACCD217261D892B62’ +
‘41F37A628110B3BDFEA4BFA8CD20A916652AD2161ECAF17C6446C’ +

‘F63853058B7B33687B3B545DC94E8685BCB7275EF9EE133DA7D91’ +
‘B2C4CF8CB3C8F7D41DE120E55367D1F2FB37044699E1DCF758105’ +

‘CDF8ED73C83FFFEDD737’);
end;

Procedure LetsFight;
begin
while(not(FindColor(x,y, 11378148, 0, 0, 520, 340)))do
begin
AreWeIn;
end;
AreWeIn;
end;

Procedure AreWeIn;
begin
while(FindColor(x, y, 11378148, 0, 0, 520, 340))do
begin
Writeln(‘Youve appeared to have been logged out, Finding login button’);
if(FindBitmap(playnow, x, y))then
begin
Writeln(‘Play now button Found!’);
Mouse(x,y,2,3,true);
if(FindBitmap(enterbutton, x, y))then
begin
Writeln(‘Login button found!’);
Mouse(x,y,2,3,true);
LetsFight;
end;
end;
end;
end;

begin
bitmaps;
AreWeIn;
LetsFight;
end;

end.[/code]

I added a procedure to the top of your bitmaps… and added that procedure to your mainline.

Read full topic

item.title: HelpaNoob
item.dc:creator: @paranoyyde paranoyyde
item.description:
@paranoyyde wrote:

Trying to reintroduce myself to SCAR - having problems

It’s the dreaded “Indentifier expected” again

Heres the code

[code]program New;
{.include SSI2.txt}
{.include boxbreaker.txt}
{.include RedXIIsFordCracker.txt}

var
enterbutton, playnow : Integer;

enterbutton := BitmapFromString(48, 23, ‘z78DAAD98C18EC2300’ +

‘510F2B48775CD52719EF979C79BA884479256207F7D8F1AA3DAEE’ +
‘FD5FC840BD6BB5E6BD0DEA4F1CB9C36F311F700338E9BB05EC28C’ +
‘EC5C72AF95E7CF21AAC9548F5E83BE1415FEA5528EE0FA9160608’ +
‘03437C27E0E313CC77748FC428F15C824B232BDAE4D77F37BEF59’ +
‘F3D27DDA94646930DEA0FFDB447FD1439753ADB7176A8BD374D78’ +
‘6A37481E3A8549E446BE674D149313AB3F77D3F737EF06B57FF65’ +

playnow := BitmapFromString(65, 14, ‘z78DAAD98CD8EC2300C845’ +
‘FA922610547D0D2F77FA4951A0E8E26DFD486EDC142A9E33833FE’ +
‘2BFDD61FD7DE87BCF4DE5FD36F2BDBABEDFD3EE4422763279EAEF’ +
‘2B7EFD7C7894EF4E4D19EBD4F3278A8526F31C961E1A7DDFAD62E’ +

Procedure LetsFight;
begin
while(FindColor(x,y, 11378148, 0, 0, 520, 340) != true)do
begin
AreWeIn;
end;
AreWeIn;
end;

Procedure AreWeIn;
begin
while(FindColor(x, y, 11378148, 0, 0, 520, 340))do
begin
Writeln(‘Youve appeared to have been logged out, Finding login button’);
if(FindBitmap(playnow, x, y))then
begin
Writeln(‘Play now button Found!’);
Mouse(x,y,2,3,true);
if(FindBitmap(enterbutton, x, y))then
begin
Writeln(‘Login button found!’);
Mouse(x,y,2,3,true);
LetsFight;
end;
end;
end;
end;

begin
AreWeIn;
LetsFight;
end;

end.

[/code]

With error:

Line 57: [Error] (4915:1): Identifier expected in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\Scripts\Test\findcolorspiraltest.scar

Help would be very much appreciated so I can get back on my feet again.

Read full topic
